nodes.name: _registerNodeInternal

activateNewLogic().details: this will remove the current contract as owner of the NodeRegistryDataonly callable after 47 since the new logicContract has been registered

adminRemoveNodeFromRegistry(address).details: only callable by the adminKey-accountonly callable in the 1st year after deployment

adminUpdateLogic(address).details: only callable by the owner of the contract

params._newLogic: the address of the new logic contract

constructor.details: cannot be deployed in a genesis block

convict(bytes32).details: The v,r,s paramaters are from the signature of the wrong blockhash that the node provided

params._hash: keccak256(wrong blockhash, msg.sender, v, r, s); used to prevent frontrunning.

registerNode(string,uint192,uint64,uint2.details: the supported tokens have to be approved by the owner first

params._url: the url of the node, has to be unique
params._weight: how many requests per second the node is able to handle

registerNodeFor(string,uint192,address,u.details: the supported tokens have to be approved by the owner firstwill call the registerNodeInteral functionin order to prove that the owner has controll over the signer-address he has to sign a messagewhich is calculated by the hash of the url, properties, weight and the ownerwill revert when a wrong signature has been provided

params._url: the url of the node, has to be unique
params._weight: how many requests per second the node is able to handle

returnDeposit(address).details: only callable by the owner of the former signer

revealConvict(address,bytes32,uint256,ui.details: reverts if a block with that number cannot be found in either the latest 256 blocks or the blockhash registryreverts when tryin to convict someone with a correct blockhashreverts when trying to reveal immediately after calling convictreverts when the _signer did not sign the blockreverts when the wrong convict hash (see convict-function) is used

params._blockNumber: number of the wrongly provided blockhash
params._signer: the address that signed the wrong blockhash

transferOwnership(address,address).details: reverts when trying to change ownership of an inactive nodereverts when trying to pass ownership to 0x0reverts when the sender is not the current owner

params._signer: the signer-address of the in3-node, used as an identifier

unregisteringNode(address).details: reverts when the provided address is not an in3-signerreverts when not called by the owner of the nodereverts when the node is not active

updateNode(address,string,uint192,uint64.details: if there is an additional deposit the owner has to approve the tokenTransfer beforereverts when the sender is not the owner of the nodereverts when the signer does not own a nodereverts when trying to change the url to an already existing one

params._props: the new properties, will be changed if different from the current onec
params._signer: the signer-address of the in3-node, used as an identifier
params._url: the url, will be changed if different from the current one
params._weight: the amount of requests per second the node is able to handle

adminRemoveNodeFromRegistry(address).notice: removes an in3-server from the registry

adminUpdateLogic(address).notice: sets the address for a new (pending) logic         the update can only be applied after 47 days,         giving all the nodes enough time to unregister their node if they dislike the update

convict(bytes32).notice: commits a blocknumber and a hashmust be called before revealConvict

registerNode(string,uint192,uint64,uint2.notice: register a new node with the sender as owner

registerNodeFor(string,uint192,address,u.notice: register a new node as a owner using a different signer address

returnDeposit(address).notice: returns the deposit of a former node after the timeout has passed

revealConvict(address,bytes32,uint256,ui.notice: reveals the wrongly provided blockhash, so that the node-owner will lose its deposit

supportedToken().notice: returns the supported ERC20 token for registering a node

transferOwnership(address,address).notice: changes the ownership of an in3-node

unregisteringNode(address).notice: a node owner can unregister a node, removing it from the nodeListdoing so will also lock his deposit for the timeout of the node

updateNode(address,string,uint192,uint64.notice: updates a node by changing its props
